sentence.Network_en: He says his accusers are trying to discredit government foreign-aid policies.
sentence.Network_cn: 他说他的责难者试图使政府的对外援助政策名声扫地。

sentence.Network_en: He said such methods would discredit the party worldwide.
sentence.Network_cn: 他说这一举措会让该政党在全世界名誉扫地。

sentence.Network_en: They spread disinformation in order to discredit politicians.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们散布假消息，企图败坏政治家的名声。

PerfectNetExp.abs: 英语词根词缀记忆大全 ... accredit v 委任；信任 discredit v 不信任，怀疑 credulous a 轻信的.
《疯狂英语2003合集全部文本》（一） ... ) demented a. 发狂的 ) discredit v. 不信，怀疑 ) stun v. 使晕倒，惊吓.
英语词根词缀记忆大全 ... accredit v 委任；信任 discredit v 不信任，怀疑 credulous a 轻信的.
GRE填空题高频词汇集锦（上）_新东方网 ... whereas 但是 discredit 使怀疑; 败坏…的名声 distinctive 独特的.

list.abs: 陈琦类反单项班GRE词汇二10Section_百度文库 ... incredible 难以置信的 discredit accredit 受权 elocution 对话绕圈子的话.
什么意思... ... completely discredited 威风扫地 be discredited 失去信任 discredited flimsy 不足信的.
...然不想就此(In this connection)颜面扫地(Thoroughly discredited)，即是最后未能小组出线，但本场制服则是谢绝有失。
That guy is a discredit to his family and relatives and friends ., 那个家伙是他家庭 , 亲戚朋友的一种耻辱.

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent.: from dis- (expressing reversal) + credit, on the pattern of Italian (di)scredito (noun), (di)screditare (verb), and French discrédit (noun), discréditer (verb)

entry.tran: 败坏…的名声;使丧失信誉;使丢脸
entry.def: To discredit someone or something means to cause them to lose people's respect or trust.

example.ex: ...a secret unit within the company that had been set up to discredit its major rival...
example.tran: 公司里设立的败坏其主要竞争对手名声的秘密部门

example.ex: He says his accusers are trying to discredit government foreign-aid policies...
example.tran: 他说他的责难者试图使政府的对外援助政策名声扫地。

entry.def: To discredit an idea or evidence means to make it appear false or not certain.

example.ex: They realized there would be difficulties in discrediting the evidence.
example.tran: 他们意识到要揭穿这个证据困难重重。

means.word_mean: 1. the state of being held in low esteem;

sentences.sentence: "your actions will bring discredit to your name"
"because of the scandal the school has fallen into disrepute"

means.word_mean: 1. cause to be distrusted or disbelieved;

sentences.sentence: "The paper discredited the politician with its nasty commentary"

means.word_mean: 3. reject as false; refuse to accept

auth_sentence.content: What a weak attempt to discredit "Expelled" .
auth_sentence.res_content_con: What a weak attempt to discredit "Expelled" .

auth_sentence.content: So trying to discredit or disprove it means nothing.
auth_sentence.res_content: So trying to discredit or disprove it means nothing.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: So trying to discredit or disprove it means nothing.

auth_sentence.content: Such conduct brings discredit on the name of Athens.
auth_sentence.res_content: Such conduct brings discredit on the name of Athens.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Such conduct brings discredit on the name of Athens.

stems_affixes.word_buile: cred相信+ible能……的→adj.可靠的,可信的
cred相信,信任+ulous多……的→相信太多→轻信的
in不+credulous[adj.轻信的,易信的]→adj.怀疑的, 不轻信的
cred相信,信任+it表抽象名词→ n.&v.信任;贷款;n.学分
cred相信,信任+ential表形容词或名词→让人相信的东西→凭据
credulous[[adj.轻信的,易信的]]→n.易信, 轻信
cred相信,信任+it表抽象名词→ n.&v.信任;贷款;n.学分
ac给予+credit[ n.&v.信任;贷款;n.学分]→给予相信→委托
dis不+credit[ n.&v.信任;贷款;n.学分]→v.不信任,怀疑

means.word_mean: 使不相信, 使怀疑;败坏…的名声

sentences.en: The idea that the sun goes round the earth has long been discredited.
sentences.cn: 太阳绕着地球转的观念早已不为人们所信了。

means.word_mean: 拒绝相信, 不相信, 怀疑

sentences.en: One should discredit a good deal of what is printed in newspapers.
sentences.cn: 对报纸上登的不少东西都不应相信。

means.word_mean: 丧失信誉, 丧失名誉

sentences.en: Their behaviour has bought discredit on English football.
sentences.cn: 他们的行为败坏了英国足球运动的声誉。

means.word_mean: 败坏名声的人或事, 耻辱

sentences.en: That boy is a discredit to his family.
sentences.cn: 那个男孩是家门的耻辱。
